channel.title: Java problem
channel.description:
hey ppl i got something wrong with my java wann know wat it is
[code]load: class loader.class not found.

item.title: Java problem
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

ginger:

i need a new version 1.4.2 can you tell me the page where can i download it then i can play the moparscape[br][size=1]Posted at: October 23, 2006, 12:13:22 PM[/size][hr]eny1

you need the new version 1.5, java.com

Read full topic

item.title: Java problem
item.dc:creator: @soul_swiper soul swiper
item.description:
@soul_swiper wrote:

where do i get this proxy encryption

Read full topic

item.title: Java problem
item.dc:creator: @iwasinmoparseas101cl iwasinmoparseas101class
item.description:
@iwasinmoparseas101cl wrote:

you’d still need the access to the open port. If they blocked traffic to the port, running the prog off of a flash drive or something won’t affect it. Not sure if this would work, but you could try using a proxy with encryption to try to get around it. Once again…NOT SURE IF IT WILL WORK

Read full topic

item.title: Java problem
item.dc:creator: @soul_swiper soul swiper
item.description:
@soul_swiper wrote:

well the techs went lil crazy decide block java and other things

wat happens put java on usb that work???

Read full topic

item.title: Java problem
item.dc:creator: @iwasinmoparseas101cl iwasinmoparseas101class
item.description:
@iwasinmoparseas101cl wrote:

yeah you might not have port access to whatever port you’re trying to access…but if it’s the HTTP port (80), they shouldn’t have it blocked

Read full topic

item.title: Java problem
item.dc:creator: @DeadBird DeadBird
item.description:
@DeadBird wrote:

Maybe your school doesn’t allow access to that port?
(I’m assuming the errors are from trying to load runescape… which means you accessed the webpage on port 80, which schools usually allow, but almost all other ports are blocked. e.g, runescape’s servers are on port 43594)

Read full topic

item.description:
@frank wrote:

from all the http connection errors it looks as though you dont have access to the net?
